Patient Particulars: Name: Tommy; Sex: Male; Marital status: Married; Occupation: Unemployed
Past Session Information: Last session was 1 week ago where patient discussed his about his possibility of losing job, and that he has been sleeping more than usual. His wife along with his children moved out of their home. It was then followed by an assessment for depression.
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Low mood
2. Feelings of worthlessness
3. Loss of pleasure in activities
Associated disturbance: Disruption in daily functioning
History: Present history: Patient was maintaining well until he met with an accident. He has been experiencing feelings of worthlessness and doesn't get the motivation to get out of bed as he feels hopeless; Personal history: Marital history- he is married and has children; Occupation history- He used to work in a car factory; Premorbid personality: Use of leisure time- He spent time with his children and they used to go to a park or to watch a movie every weekend. He also liked fishing and spending time with friends.
Current Mental Status Examination: Behaviour: Rapport could be established and the patient was cooperative; Mood- Depressed; Affect- Restricted; Thought: Content- reflected ideas of hopelessness and worthlessness
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient expressed his persistent feeling of worthlessness and hopelessness for which some techniques were introduced by the therapist.
Clinical Diagnosis by Reviewer: F32.2 Severe depressive episode without psychotic symptoms
Action Plan: Patient has to maintain a diary where he as to write about his negative automatic thought and how it made him feel along with the action taken. He also has to do at least one activity that he earlier found pleasurable and also make a note of it in the same manner in the diary.
